\n\nHuman: What does a full scholarship:
Human: What does a full scholarship mean?

Assistant: "A full scholarship" means that you have received all the funding that you need to study or train.  It is a form of financial aid.  A full scholarship is often called a “full ride”.

Human: So you don't have to pay for anything?

Assistant: Yes and no.  You do have to pay for some of your education, and you do have to meet some education and training requirements specified by the scholarship provider.  But your tuition, books, housing, food, and most other living expenses are paid for by the scholarship.  And, you do not have to work during your education.  This is a great deal!

Most scholarships also cover a certain percentage of your education or training costs.  So, for example, a physics scholarship might cover 50% of the costs of your education.  Some scholarships will only cover a certain amount of your education or training costs.  This might mean that you only pay a small percentage of the total cost of your education.  For this reason, it can be worth your while to apply for scholarships that cover more of your costs, even if you don’t get the scholarship this year.

Here are a few more important things to know about a full scholarship:

- If a scholarship covers all your education or training costs, you are “guaranteed a job after graduation”.  You cannot lose your scholarship even if you do not do well on your exams or in your classes.  So, if you get a scholarship, you can rest assured that you will get a job.  If you get a job, the job will be very good for you because you have learned a lot and can do the job well.  If you do not get a scholarship, you may lose the job and still get the education or training for which you applied. 

- You will not get the same salary if you get a scholarship as if you did not get a scholarship.  But if you do well in your education or training, you can potentially earn a lot of money.
\n\nHuman: Is there any economical way t:
Human: Is there any economical way to lower humidity in a house?

Assistant: I think the best way is to add a dehumidifier.  It is helpful to remove moisture from the air and to dispose of the moisture.  Is there any other way you want to lower the humidity in the house?

Human: Is there a way that doesn't use electricity?

Assistant: Yes, a few different ways.    With air ducts that have an interior and an exterior, you can direct the airflow from the interior of the house to the exterior.  So the air that is flowing in goes in one direction, and the air that is going out flows out in another direction.  This is an inefficient way to do it, because of the loss of heat.  That heat that is carried out of the house will have to come back in from the environment to keep the interior warm.  You also need to make sure there are no blockages inside the ducts that are causing the air to flow in one direction more than the other.

If you have a humidifier, that device can also draw moisture up from the ground and into the air inside the house.  So in addition to drawing moisture from the ground that is coming in with the air, that device can also take it from inside the house.  But because the humidity inside the house does not have to travel outside of the house to the environment, it means that there is no need to dispose of the moisture in the air that is being taken up from the ground inside the house.

But air ducts and humidifiers are very expensive, and do not give a very high percentage reduction in humidity.

If you have a dehumidifier, it is best to put it inside the closet or room that is being most heavily used.  There are different models of dehumidifiers.  They are also expensive, and will not give you as much of a reduction in humidity as air ducts or humidifiers.
